runs.comm: slash! But he finds point. Bit of a loose delivery to start off as he affords a hint of room to free his arms.
that's better, hits a good length and manages to jag it back off the track and cramp Ahmadi. He'd been setting up for another slice, but has to simply wear it
fullish on off stump, carefully kept out to point
resorts to a back of a length delivery on middle, Ahmadi is up off his toes to nudge to square leg
lovely channel, teasing the batsman to edge onto his front foot and yield to the impulse to drive. Ahmadi is better than that though and leaves
slapped to mid-off, and it's hit powerful enough that the captain misfields. Fuller delivery tagged with just enough width to entice Ahmadi's ire. That was crunched!
a bit short to start off and Ahmadi attempts to guide it away behind point. Doesn't succeed
needs to adjust his length here, it's still too short and the batsman would prefer to be on the back foot when there is as much movement as there is today. Slapped through point and cover
fuller delivery on off stump brings Ahmadi forward to block
that's more like it, gives the ball every opportunity to swing by pitching it up. Ahmadi steps forward cautiously and blocks
chopped towards point, Ahmadi thought there was more room on this short ball than in reality
fullish on off stump, carefully run down to point
tests the middle of the pitch, but puts a bit too much into it. Soars over the batsman's head outside off as he leaves
back of a length and in the off-stump channel. Presents the open face to pick the gap behind point
pins him to the crease as he probes on middle. Ahmadi can only defend the back of a length delivery

so that's how they're going to deal with the early movement. Ensure it doens't happen by leaping down the track and hammering the ball (out of shape, possibly by the power in the stroke) through the covers
instant riposte from the bowler who goes back of a length on middle. Defended
point flails to his left, but Ahmadi has placed this tap wide of him. Shortish delivery has a bit too much width
goes short and a shade outside off, Mangal sways out of the way
fullish on off stump, Ahmadi blocks to point
a touch short, but not quite wide enough for Ahmadi's intent to cut. Inside edges to the man in the ring
runs down the track and canes a good length ball over mid-off. Scotland don't have express pace and if he is confident enough of his ability, he should try doing that more and upsetting their lengths
and that's what happens when you rattle a bowler with your intent. He bowls a poor ball - this was short and wide - and Ahmadi unveils that cut he seems quite fond of. Definitely trigger-happy today
extra bounce! He saw some width again, but Davey manages to get something off the pitch to assist him in beating the batsman
full and a shade outside off, Ahmadi steps forward to block and his bat wobbles in his hands on impact

dives, gets his fingertips to it, but it doens't stick! Magnificent effort from Mommsen, the captain, at second slip. This was back of a length and only a shade outside off, Mangal was trying to slide it away to third man but is surprised by the bounce and a hint of movement back at him. Then it was down to Mommsen, who propelled himself off the balls of his feet and nearly pulled off an absolute stunner.

touch too straight this time and Ahmadi goes for a flick and has enough on it to travel almost to the midiwcket boundary. Amazing effort by the fielder again who dived headlong after the ball and pulled it back
back of a length and outside off, and it gets some lift too, Mangal is beaten again
full on middle, Mangal clips it behind square leg to get off strike and raise a 1000 ODI runs

gee, he's had a terrific lunch and seems to want to go back for more before the hour's done. Runs at the bowler again and wallops a good length ball over extra cover. Very clean hitting this from Ahmadi. Had a short point in place top stop a stroke like that, so he went straighter instead
back of a length on middle and length, nudges towards square leg

now that's what I call a double team. Coetzer delivers the diving slide first,  but the ball was still headed to the boundary, so MacLeod who was backing up had to cut in and pull off a second diving save. What teamwork from Scotland. They're in this all the way, and finally Coetzer sends in the throw and in all the maniacal fielding, I forgot where the ball went
shortish and a shade outside off, defended. And oddly, that stayed rather low
beaten outside off! This held it's line outside off and had the batsman groping away from his body. Mangal may have 1000 runs to his name, but he's not having fun out there right now
good length ball gets him to jump across on off stump and defend
shortish and outside off, glided towards point. Did well against the extra bounce there
lesser of two evils there as Wardlaw concedes a wide to stop Ahmadi from cashing in after he had stepped down the track
goes shortish and tucks him up on middle and leg, seems a very good ploy that against him. The ball takes the top half of the bat and lands safely. Calls for short leg anyone?
back of a length and nipping back in at Ahmadi and he has no clue after the ball jags back in and thuds into his inside edge. This is top bowling from Wardlaw
full on off stump brings down the straight face of the bat in reply

heave ho after advancing down the track and this time he explores the area behind cow corner. So he's good at hitting either side of the park if he has room to free his arms. Good length balls being clattered

short-armed pull and he's timed it amazingly! It might have dawned on Wardlaw that his strength on the front foot might mean he doens't go back too often. But this time Ahmadi swivels on the back foot and pulls so strongly through midwicket
back of a length and outside off, sliced to deep third man

another stunning effort at deep fine leg! Gardiner was the man there, hurtling in after the top-edged pull swirls in his area. Threw himself forward to make something out of nothing and got both hands to it. He would feel hard done by. And it was a top delivery as well, rising about the batsman's eyeline and cramping him on the pull

not this time! Gets a fuller ball to nip back in and catch Mangal's feet dozing. Evans yells in delight after hitting the uncertain length just outside off and getting that 'just enough' movement to beat the batsman and toppled his stumps
nips out of his crease to block a good length ball on off stump

yep! Slashed through the covers - right through Machan - in fact. Had to move a bit to his left, but it came at him a bit too quick for him to get the body behind it. The fuller length is being battered away like it's a bad spirit by the Afghan batsmen
so Evans trusts his height and elicits just enough bounce off the back of a length delivery to have Stanikzai nicking off. Double-wicket over and he is bringing Scotland back on his own
fullish and on the pads, clipped to short fine leg for a quick single
seeks the yorker, that curls in on middle. Shenwari keeps it out, if a bit nervously
fuller delivery with a little shape away from the bat, Shenwari is conscious of playing within himself as he blocks to mid-off
plays inside the line at a fuller delivery on off stump and is lucky to manage a little outside edge to deep third man
good length ball with enough room on the off side to tempt Ahmadi again, but point stops the crisply timed drive
a bit too straight that time, but it's understandable with Ahmadi's impuse to attack the off side. Plus short midwicket is on hand to stop it
catches him on the thigh pad with a back of a length delivery that zips in at him. The flick is a bit slow and he can't make contact.
full on off stump, defended into the midwicket region
back of a length and outside off, run in front of point with the open face. Couple of steps forward to look for the single, but he has to go back
attempts to dig on in, but it barely rises outside off. Shenwari had committed to swaying away and the ball crosses him around hip-height
ripper! Nails that nervous length  for the batsman where he doesn't know whether to go forward or back. Shenwari is rooted to his crease and is beaten by away swing to boot. Terrific delivery
shortish and slanted in at the batsman, good follow-up, and Shenwari leaps off his feet to guide it towards point
down the track, but Evans had refused any room for the batsman and Ahmadi can only get a inside edge which deflects off his pad and goes to the keeper on the bounce
back of a length on middle, clipped into the yawning space at midwicket and the keeper has to rush after it
fuller delivery to tease the drive out of him, Shenwari gets only an inside edge, though, to long leg
goes short and slips it down the leg side, Ahmadi has showed he is not shy of pulling. But this time he fails to connect
full on middle, punched to mid-on
again, he's got some serious power in those forearms! Went back as he picked up the shortish length and barely had a followthrough as he pulled well in front of midwicket. Magnificent ball-striking
and a top reply from Davey! Cracks Ahmadi open like a can of baked beans. This is full and seeking the top of off stump, then decides it doesn't want it and jags away to beat the pushing bat
banged in short and Shenwari sinks under it. Bit too high says the square leg umpire
goes short again, this seems to be a plan in action, Shenwari veers his eyes off the ball and sways away
brings him to poke outside the off stump and a bit of nip away almost had him. Evans is using his length and his ability to extract bounce admirably well.
shortish and outside off, with a little "ahh" for effort, Shenwari says "eh" with a leave
shortish and outside off, not bothered with
that's perfectly timed. He's had to work for this, or rather wait for this, and gets the short ball that he wants outside off. Cracked away to deep point boundary
keeps going short, despite the trio in the cordon, Shenwari runs it to point
turn on offer, but he's dragged the length short and it's been pulled to deep midwicket
looped up outside off, and the ball drifts away as well. Defends
huge appeal from the bowler as Shenwari steps across to tickle the ball fine. Too much turn there to be given
goes back to a slow, flat delivery on middle and it's clipped to square leg. Ahmadi wants the strike, but not off this delivery. Has to scamper back as the throw comes in

lovely, loopy delivery outside off and the batsman nudges it in front of square leg for the single he wants. It's not there as the fielder lobs the throw in. Should have been quicker and flatter to catch him short and that's the verdict from the third ump
75kph, tossed up on middle, Shewari waits and clips it through midwicket
good length ball on middle, tucked to midwicket
Machan dives, Machan saves a boundary! It was full and had enough width for the flay from Shenwari. But he is not let off as the fielder leaps to his left and grabs the ball as if it were chocolate
back of a length on middle and Shenwari can only block again
fuller delivery outside off, slid to point. How is Ahmadi faring being starved of strike?
short and wide and there's the release for Shenwari. A cut shot that spells relief all the way to the point boundary. Evans might need a break now
goes full and slips a fuller ball down the leg side. He's trying a bit too much, he knows he has to with the total they've got to defend
goes wide of the crease to delivery a good length ball that holds its line to whistle past Shenwari's outside edge. And he's back
stays back to a good length ball on middle and clips it through the gap at square leg
tossed up just outside off, Shenwari taps it back at the bowler
tossed up outside off and drifting further away, Shenwari pushes at it and gets an inside edge
defends a good length ball just outside off
tickled around the corner to square leg as he gets his front leg across outside off to make the shot happen
gets down the track and reaches the tossed up delivery on the full. Then it's a simple matter of tapping it down to long-on
starts with a juicy short ball outside off and he flays it through point. There is protection in the deep though
gets the ball to jump at Ahmadi on off stump, but he has been in long enough to adjust to it and run it down to third man with softer hands than he usually attempts
fuller delivery on off stump, defended
fullish on middle and off, Shenwari is solidly behind it
good length ball on middle and leg, helped on its way to deep midwicket
good length ball on and around off stump, sliced to point
too short, but he seems to have cover for the error. Cut shot stopped by the sweeper
flighted on off stump, kept out
tossed up on middle and Shenwari unleashes a booming sweep behind square leg and finds an area Haq hasn't plugged. Intelligent batting
flighted outside off, nudged towards midwicket
flighted outside off, defended calmly
tossed up on off stump, kept out capably and that shall be drinks

clever shot! Top results. But it could all have gone awry. Saw the short ball, knew he could get under and tap it over the slips. And only just about manages that. Haq leaps as high as he could and sticks out a hand. Can't pull it down

sliced to deep third man to bring up a fifty off only 48 balls. This is an innings that Afghanistan wanted. Setting the tone and easing the nerves in the dressing room. And what's more, he's appeared to have settled down
beautiful cricket! Its short and rising above the batsman's chest, Shenwari was set up first to glide it down to third man, then realised the threat it posed and swayed well away from it
shortish and outside off, slapped down to third man perfectly this time
short and wide, but Ahmadi has slapped it straight at point
fullish on middle, clipped to deep square leg

that's high into the air. More height than distance and Machan has claimed a smart take to send the Scottish fans into cheers. The batsman threw his head down straight away after he raced down the track and chose to go for a smite down the ground despite getting to the pitch of the ball. Hit a bit too far up on the bat and lost all his timing
shortish and outside off, pushed through point to get off the mark
back of a good length on off stump, nudged into the leg side
shortish on off stump, defended stoutly
full on off stump, he drives down the ground to mid-on who has a shy at the stumps but can't hit the target
good length ball on off stump, defended
back of a length on off stump, defended
a hint of away movement off the deck, but it's so minimal that the batsman is confidently behind it
full on off stump, no movement in the air though. Shenwari strikes it firmly to mid-on
fullish on off stump, but he's got into the shot a bit too early. Gets an inside edge towards midwicket
fullish and outside off, that time the ball did nibble away to the take the outside edge to deep third man

full and seemed to be sliding down. But not to the umpire's eyes. A little chat with the non-striker and up they go for the review. It was a fuller ball, going on with the angle in at the batsman. Nabi looks for a flick and misses. Wears it low enough on the pad and HawkEye says about 20 percent of the ball would be hitting the stumps - that's just shaving the stumps - and the umpire's original call of out stands

Oh, what have you done, Majid Haq! Beautiful delivery in the off stump channel, teasing the flashy drive from the batsman and out it came in all its glory. The outside edge sails to first slip who moves to his left but fails to hold on to a dolly. Don't even think he got a hand to it
fuller delivery outside off, defended
keeps out another fullish delivery going for his stumps
shortish and outside off, slapped towards point
good length ball on middle and leg, clipped through midwcket

full on off stump, Zazai gets in line quite well but then fails to connect! Stands plumb in front. Dibbly-dobbly medium pace has been quite effective on this pitch and Berrington benefits for keeping it simple
back of a length on off stump, defended
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed to mid-off
back of a length and outside off, Shenwari watches it sail into the keeper's gloves.
banged in short and Shenwari ducks under it comfortably
full on middle and leg, clipped to long leg
fullish on off stump, Najibullah defends carefully
a bit too much effort from Berrington there as the inswinger slides down leg
back of a length on off stump, defended calmly
and he's heard you. Gets forward to a fuller delivery outside off and eases it past point
that's top stuff! Scotland have got their venom back in the last few overs and the offcutter leaps past the outside edge of Najibullah's tentative poke
nothing streaky about this as he climbs on a fuller length and creams it through the covers. Amazing timing
moves around the wicket for a good length ball on off stump, defended

there we go, Haq's made amends and Berrington has two in two overs! Floated the offcutter up to pull the drive on the up, becomes a thick outside edge and Haq at first slip moves to his right and picks up a reverse cup. The Scottish fans have flipped the volume back up in Dunedin.
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with
back of a length on off stump, tapped into the midwicket region

Haq's on fire and Naib's been bounced out! He was afraid of being hit by the ball and midway through taking evasive action he realises the ball wasn't quite a short as it had seemed in his mind. Fends it away and it lobs up to behind gully. Only it hung in the air long enough for Haq to run to his right from first slip and grab it by his fingertips
back of a length delivery on off stump, defended
and it was too - full and targeting the base of off stump - but he keeps it out
good length ball on off stump, defended into the midwicket region
back of a length on off stump, defended
back of a length and outside off, tapped away to deep third man
full and slanted into the pads, clipped to long leg
shortish on off stump, pushed in front of point
full on middle, Dawlat presents a lovely example of a push into the leg side
fuller delivery outside off, Shenwari is forward with a solid block
goes short on middle and leg, Shenwari evades it well
pokes and is beaten outside off at a good length ball that nibbles just enough away from him
a bit short, but not enough width to pierce the cover field
extra bounce from Davey, who has to soften the grip on his bat, get up as high as he could and bunt it down towards point. Well played
goes short and a shade outside off, Shenwari taps it to point and that's a maiden
seems a slower ball on middle, neatly tucked through square leg for a couple that raises their hundred
good length ball outside off, Dawlat shoulders arms
fullish and outside off, pushed into the covers
short and on off stump, Dawlat barely flinches as he stands up tall and blocks it and gets a nod of encouragement from his senior partner
good length ball on off stump, defended stoutly
slower ball on off stump, Dawlat gets forward to block
goes full on off stump, Shenwari punches it to mid-off
good length ball on off stump, with a hint of nibble away. Defended
shortish on middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
stays beside the short ball outside off and runs it into the covers. Dawlat's looking quite decent out there
creditably keeps out a yorker on off stump. People, this is not over yet.
corker! Too good for the outside edge. Angled in at Dawlat so he had to try and defend himself, but then the ball leaps away past the outside edge so handsomely

beamer to start off! Second one in the match and Shenwari's taken a knock on his hips. Poor fellow, wouldn't have expected that and the square umpire calls it a no-ball. The full toss was on it's downward trend though? Touch and go?
full and curling in at the batsman who manages a little bit of a leading edge as he had tried to flick through midwicket
length ball outside off, slapped to mid-off
rocks back and cuts the short ball to the sweeper, who does excellent work racing to his left. Gardiner, I think
shortish on middle and off, Shenwari was trying to whip it through midwicket but has to settle for his leading edge not popping up in the air
gets across on off stump and tickles a shortish delivery to long leg
full and veering in at the batsman, clipped behind square leg
shortish on and around off stump, defended
good length ball on middle, Shenwari blocks it resolutely
fuller delivery outside off, eased into the covers
full toss on middle, punched back at the bowler
banged in short on middle and leg, ducks under it
shortish and outside off, patted down to deep third man
fuller delivery angled in at the batsman, Dawlat defends inside the line of it and gets a thick edge to deep third man. Shenwari denies the single to keep strike. Well, well...
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed back at the bowler

mauls a good length ball on middle stump with the perfect agricultural slog. But Scotland aren't giving anything away. MacLeod races after it ti try and drag the ball back before it reaches the fence, but isn't able to. Top effort
full on off stump, Shenwari plants his front leg down and hammers it over mid-off. There's no one back on the boundary. Looks like Shenwari's decided to be Maxwell
fuller delivery outside off, defended
low full toss, with a bit of cut back in, Shenwari taps it to mid-on. Last ball of the over then, what will he do?
gets across on off stump and clips a good length ball to deep midwicket
flighted on off stump, Shenwari tickles it into the leg side and Dawlat sets off at the other end. No single there though and he has to hurry back
flighted outside off, defended carefully
loop outside off and Shenwari waits for it before driving in front of point
flighted on off stump, Dawlat defends quite competently
tossed up outside off, defended having reached the pitch
amazing flight on this ball outside off, and Shenwari actually reaches as deep in his crease as he could to tap the ball with an open face
good length ball on off, he comes forward and presses it back to the bowler
fuller and straight, tucked away towards deep midwicket for a single
veering down leg, Dawlat tickles it fine, beating the keeper. Berrington has his hands on his head
fullish and curling in around off, squirted past square leg off an inside edge
good length ball outside off, dabbed in front of point
pitched up and outside off, Shenwari comes forward and laces it to the off side sweeper and retains strike
flighted outside off, Shenwari blocks into the covers
flighted on middle, defended
"No, no, no, Berru," he yells again but Berrington is unable to stop the whip off Shenwari's legs at short midwicket
goes around the wicket and tosses up a fuller ball on off stump, defended
goes back to a good length ball and clips it behind square leg
quite slow and generously tossed up on middle. Batsman taps it to short midwicket
low full toss on the pads, Dawlat clips it to long leg and looks more an more able with each over
smokes a pretty full ball down the ground. Mighty wristwork from Shenwari, bested an almost yorker-length delivery with great class
good length ball outside off, slid off the open face to point
shortish and outside off, pummeled to deep cover off one foot. Means he's trading his balance away for power
good length ball outside off, defended. Afghanistan need only 79 off 91. Not beyond them, Not while Shenwari is here

but this will help Scotland! A rush of blood from Dawlat as he sizes up a length ball and throws his bat at it. Spies his bat as soon as it made contact, realising that he had not timed it at all. Mommsen runs back from short cover, takes a great catch staring up into the stun and tumbles over. Fielding to the fore again! And Shenwari bangs his bat into the turf at the non-strikers' end and stares daggers at Dawlat as he walks past him
slugged over the man at midwicket, but there is protection in the deep. Lusty bowl that.
flighted on off stump, defended well
good length ball on off stump, Hamid tries to work it into the on side but the ball goes on with the angle and takes the leading edge
goes back to block a good length ball on middle and leg
flighted on middle, defended
presses forward and blocks calmly
full on off stump, punched back down the ground but to the left of the bowler. Berrington doesn't care as he throws himself at the ball on his followthrough and keeps Shenwari on strike
banged in a bit short and Shenwari jumps deep into his crease and hammers the offcutter into the covers. Almost pierces the gap

that's two for Shenwari, it's what he wants and he goes past fifty as well. Slow, short ball on middle and it's been pulled viciously. Barely celebrates despite all the applause from the crowd and his team-mates
good length ball on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
good length ball outside off, shoulders arms
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with again
fuller delivery outside off, Shenwari knows he needs to start takings risks now and one of those doesn't pay off. Goes for an almighty swing and is beaten off a fuller delivery outside off
banged in short and Shenwari has swivelled back and nails a pull to deep square leg. Amazing shot, but he can't take a run and he hates it. Flings his bat at the air again
seeks the yorker on middle, ends up a low full toss on leg and it's picked away to deep midwicket
shortish and outside off, slid towards point
good length ball on off stump, defended
full on middle and off, pushed to mid-on
good length ball a shade outside off, slid towards point
what a strike! Flat, hard and shows how to deal with a slower ball. Picked it up early and walloped it over the midwicket boundary with considerable disdain
shortish and outside off, Shenwari stays beside the ball and unleashes a whirl of his wrists as he cuts the ball through the gap at point
good length ball on the pads, nudged towards midwicket to try and keep strike. Walks up to Hamid for a little glove love and some encouraging words. Scotland were 149 for 8 at this time
full on off stump, Hamid is paranoid about protecting his stumps. Covers all of them as he blocks
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with. Shenwari has the strike back. Scotland have a job on their hands yet
good length ball on middle, kept out
flighted on off stump, Shenwari blocks into the leg side and says no straight away
slips, but Wardlaw is able to reach far enough with his hands to stop a stinging slog sweep at deep square leg

what a beautiful bit of batting! It's a flatter delivery going across the right-hander and Hamid displays the perfect lat cut. Watches it all the way onto the bat and nearly takes it off the keeper's gloves. And they take three as well! Magnificent cricket
tossed up outside off, pushed to long-on for a single
flighted on off stump, defended into the covers
full on middle, punched down to long-on. Denies the single
full on off stump, clubbed to long-on and this time he does take a single. Hamid's looked good enough to be trusted. Game back on, folks
back of a length and outside off, pushed into the covers
back of a length on middle and leg, nudged into the leg side and midwicket is quite alert. The crowd can't sit. Everyone's on their feet and the Afghanistan flag is still flying high
short and wide, but Hamid is happy to leave it be
shortish on off stump, blocked

full and outside off, slammed into the covers and it seemed destined for the boundary until Machan slid down and put a right hand out to keep it in the circle. Terrific viewing! Terrific boost to the bowler, who accepts it
back of a length on off stump, Hamid is cut in half as he can't decide between slogging and blocking.
short and a shade outside off, Hamid sways away
that's right in the blockhole outside off and Hamid squeezes it to point
shortish and outside off, lovely inviting delivery but Hamid is there for one purpose and one only - to hang in there for Shenwari - so he leaves
full on leg stump, Hamid looks for a flick and gets just enough of a deflection to contemplate a leg-bye four. But the keeper leaps to his left and stops it

MacLeod again! Failed withe bat but he's saved about 20 runs today! This was a drill that had enough force to take the  fielder over the boundary with the ball. But MacLeod is defiant and Shenwari throws his head back
tossed up on off stump, defended
good length ball on off stump, Shenwari had primed himself to go over midwicket but decided not to. Blocked
yorked himself as he comes down the track, beautiful bowler from Haq as he keeps it to an inside edge

bang! And away it screams into the stands beyond cow corner and brings the Afghan fans to their feet. It's length, it was in his slot and it was dealt with. Bows over his bat as he feels the pressure, the fatigue
searches for the single, but Haq's tossed up ball outside off and nearly induces a leading edge that carries back to him. As it stands, it falls short
shortish and outside off, tapped into the covers where Mommsen does not allow the single
good length ball on middle, clipped into the midwicket region and races off to the other end. MacLeod has a shy with a wild throw and Coetzer, backing up at mid-off, has to sprawl away to his right
full on middle, Shenwari hammers it down the ground but long-off is there to handle it
there's a bonus! It's short on middle, it's a pretty good one too. But Hamid is able to sway back and swat it away to the square leg boundayr. Didn't time it, but he'll take it and so will Shenwari
slower and very full delivery on middle and leg, turned away wide of mid-on for a single
lovely yorker on off stump keeps Shenwari quiet and off strike for the next over
good length ball on off stump, Hamid employs that late dab again but this time there was a short third man and Shenwari points him out after saying no. Good call from the senior batsman

waits on middle and leg and turns it to short fine leg, but Shenwari has raced down to the middle of the pitch and seemed stranded. The throw comes to the right and - the bowler's - but Haq, like his bowling, takes an age to break the stumps. Went for a loopy arc around the stumps instead of just jabbing to his right side after collecting the ball. Safe. Pressure showing badly on Scotland now
good length ball on middle, defended
that backlift went high over his head, but he decides to block a flatter delivery on off stump
good length ball on middle, Shenwari was leaping down the track to send it into orbit. Ends up with an inside edge onto his pads

good length ball on middle, Shenwari hits a slow sweep to deep square leg and retains strike. And amid all this tension he takes a little time to play around with Haq at the bowlers end. They collided into each other and while breaking apart, Shenwari didn't let go of Haq. "Bowl me one more slow, loopy ball, mate"
full and outside off, he looks to laser a drive through the covers but it gets an inside edge to short fine leg
shortish and outside off, he has a poke and misses. That's too close for comfort
good length ball on off stump, nudged into the midwicket region where Mommsen prowls
back of a length delivery outside off, Hamid blocks and the ball nearly rolls onto the stumps. Nearly
shortish and outside off, Hamid was deciding between two shots and then decides on a dab to third man. Single needed, single taken
full on off stump, squeezed into the point region to retain strike
it's flat and it sits up for a magnificent mow over cow corner. Shenwari has skipped down the track and is playing the innings of his life
runs down the track and Haq drifts it down the leg side. The sweep misses, but he gets the wide

another length ball sliding down leg and Shenwari has hammered another six. Nabi roars in the dressing room, Shenwari points at the bottom of the bat and indicates he has mistimed it. That's the fifty partnership for the ninth wicket!
fired into the block hole and its been blocked

flighted into the slot and Shenwari has launched it over the square leg boundary and sinks onto his knees again. He's 96 not out and he's got every scenario rolling in his head. Will hte pressure be too much? Its only 19 off 20

length ball on middle and Shenwari has picked out deep midwicket! Haq goes mad, Shenwari is on his knees in despair! What an innings! What a performance! What passion! And spare a thought for Davey on the boundary, who kept calm and pouched a good, pressure catch. But wait... the third umpire is asking him to wait. He's checking if Scotland have adhered to the field restrictions. You're allowed four outside the circle. How many did Scotland have? They had the right people and Shenwari has to walk and he does so while counting the men on the deep in his mind
tossed up on middle and Shapoor blocks
back of a length and outside off, slid down to third man. Lots of those and the odd boundary is what's needed
shortish and outside off, Shapoor flails and misses. Shenwari can't watch

sliding down leg and they go up in unison for an appeal. Umpire shakes his head and Mommsen goes for a review. Is this it? Nope, impact was off the thigh pad before Cross dived to his right and pouched a great take
full on leg stump, Shapoor moves across and clips it through midwicket and gives the strike to the better batsman
banged in short with a great big grunt from Evans and that means it's sailed too far over the head of the batsman. Wide called for height
back of a length on off stump, tapped into the point region and Hamid has to sent Shapoor back. Makes it in time before the direct hit from Berrington, but the ricochet allows the overthrow
goes back and punches a back of a length delivery through point. Looked quite capable that time
back of a length on middle, Shapoor goes right back in his crease and clips it to deep square leg and then has a chat with his partner
shortish and outside off, eased to deep third man for a single early in the over
and once it is pushed through point, up goes the roar and Afghanistan have their 200. They need 11 more but Scotland are in no mood to give them. What a match!
fuller and slower outside off, tapped into the covers. Dot ball, precious dot ball
good length ball on middle and leg, looks for a flick but only lobs off the thigh pads towards point. And the keeper races after it himself. Brilliant commitment, but can't stop the single
looks for the wide yorker, but Berrington has slid it wider than the tram lines allow. Pressure mounts, pressures shows

he's found the boundary at fine leg! This is why the extra ball matters and Shapoor got inside the line of the short slower ball and pulled it away very cheekily. Goes on a long, animated monologue with Hamid about the shot as they hug each other and contemplate....
curling yorker on off stump and it gets a thick outside edge to deep third man. Hamid did very well to protect his stumps. They're nailing their death overs discipline here, both teams

slower ball ball on middle and leg, Shapoor nudges it into the leg side and sets off. There's no single there though and Machan bounds in and delivers an underarm throw, but it misses its mark! Whoooa, the tension is getting to me!! Time for a break for Shapoor as he gets some magic spray on his left hand

he's done it! Shapoor has the vicroty and races off to one corner of the ground in his trademark celebration. The Scots are heartbroken, Shenwari is delirously happy! He wanted a yorker, ends up with a low full toss on leg stump and it's been picked off. Shapoor had stopped running as soon as the ball beat the short fine leg fielder. Spread his hands out wide and fell onto the turn in joy! What a match! What a performance! What theatre! This is how good the World Cup can be! This is how good it should be!
